item.title: 随着金融科技行业的反弹，投资者施罗德提高了 Revolut 的估值
item.description: Revolut Ltd.的一位股东认为，该公司的价值比一年前提高了45%，这表明投资者开始对金融科技行业解冻。【原文：One of Revolut Ltd.’s shareholders thinks the firm is 45% more valuable than a year ago, in a sign that investors are starting to thaw on the fintech sector.】

item.title: 据当地媒体报道，越南国家银行将于本周恢复黄金拍卖
item.description: 据《安宁秋道报》网站援引央行信息报道，越南国家银行计划最早于 4 月 17 日举行 11 年来首次金条拍卖会。【原文：The State Bank of Vietnam plans gold bar auctions for the first time in 11 years as early as April 17, An Ninh Thu Do newspaper reported on its website, citing information from the central bank.】

item.title: 印度 3 月贸易逆差收窄至 11 个月低点，原因是进口支出减少
item.description: 印度 3 月份的贸易赤字收窄至 11 个月来的最低点，原因是该国控制了进口支出，而且全球需求复苏促进了出口。【原文：India’s trade deficit narrowed to a 11-month low in March as the nation reined in its import bill and a recovery in global demand boosted exports.】

item.title: 欧元区工业反弹力度可能太弱，无法在年初为经济提供帮助
item.description: 欧元区的工业生产在 2 月份有所恢复，但幅度太小，可能无法对第一季度的经济增长做出贡献。【原文：Euro-area industrial production recovered some ground in February, though by too small an amount to make a likely contribution to economic growth in the first quarter.】

item.title: Ibec 称爱尔兰将通过出口和投资实现增长
item.description: 据商业集团 Ibec 称，随着通胀下降和降息预期推动经济增长，爱尔兰今年将实现经济增长。【原文：Ireland is set to see growth this year, according to business group Ibec, as falling inflation and expected rate cuts give its economy a boost.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击引发成本担忧，印度出口商股票下跌
item.description: 向中东出口大米和茶叶的印度公司股价下滑，原因是人们担心地缘政治紧张局势可能会造成物流阻力并增加成本负担。【原文：Shares of Indian firms that export rice and tea to the Middle East slumped amid concerns that geopolitical tensions may create logistical headwinds and add cost burden.】

item.title: 韦丹塔集团请求摩根大通安排 3 亿美元印度债券
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，韦丹塔公司已委托摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Vedanta Ltd. has mandated JPMorgan Chase & Co. to help it raise 25 billion rupees ($300 million) via rupee-denominated bonds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据说 GIP 将终止收购马来西亚港口运营商股份的计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，出于估值方面的考虑，全球基础设施合伙公司（Global Infrastructure Partners）已经搁置了从一位当地富豪手中收购马来西亚最大港口运营商最多 49% 股份的计划。【原文：Global Infrastructure Partners has shelved plans to buy up to 49% of Malaysia’s biggest port operator from a local tycoon on valuation concerns, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 万科准备 180 亿美元资产作为新贷款抵押品
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国万科集团公司（China Vanke Co.【原文：China Vanke Co., the Chinese state-backed developer that’s become the latest flashpoint in the nation’s property crisis, is preparing an asset package totaling about 130 billion yuan ($18 billion) to use as collateral as it seeks new bank loans, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 摩根大通策略师称盈利不太可能提振高涨的股票
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Don’t bank on an upbeat corporate earnings season to drive equities higher as much of the optimism is already priced in following the record-breaking rally this year, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co. strategists.】

item.title: 中国宣扬新安保法，誓言为香港提供更多支持
item.description: 在北京支持的新安全法通过一个月后，中国监管香港的最高官员承诺采取新政策帮助香港经济发展，但未透露具体细节。【原文：China’s top official overseeing Hong Kong promised new policies to help the city’s economy — without giving details — a month after the passage of a new Beijing-backed security law that’s raised concern about its future as a financial hub.】

item.title: 收购巨头 CVC 在阿姆斯特丹首次公开募股中寻求至少 12.5 亿欧元的投资
item.description: CVC Capital Partners 恢复了在阿姆斯特丹首次公开募股的计划，寻求与投资者共同筹集至少 12.5 亿欧元（13 亿美元）的资金，此次上市有可能为其他私募股权公司上市铺平道路。【原文：CVC Capital Partners revived plans for an initial public offering in Amsterdam, seeking to raise at least €1.25 billion ($1.3 billion) with its investors in a listing that potentially paves the way for other private equity firms to go public.】

item.title: 芬兰内阁在预算谈判中要求紧缩开支 30 亿欧元
item.description: 芬兰总理佩特里-奥尔波（Petteri Orpo）表示，芬兰政府正在寻求额外价值30亿欧元（32亿美元）的紧缩措施，以帮助解决日益恶化的公共财政问题。【原文：Finland’s government is seeking an additional €3 billion ($3.2 billion) worth of austerity measures to help fix its deteriorating public finances, according to Prime Minister Petteri Orpo.】

item.title: 欧洲央行辛库斯预计 2024 年将降息三次，并有可能第四次降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员格迪米纳斯-西姆库斯（Gediminas Simkus）表示，今年借贷成本将下降，并预测至少会有三次这样的举措。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus said borrowing costs will decline this year, predicting at least three such moves.】

item.title: 印尼盾将重开，中央银行面临考验
item.description: 印尼盾似乎准备在周二市场重新开盘时走弱，突破密切关注的1美元兑16,000印尼盾的水平，从而给央行加大干预力度带来压力。【原文：Indonesia’s rupiah looks poised to weaken through the closely watched 16,000-per-dollar level when markets reopen on Tuesday, putting pressure on the central bank to step up intervention.】

item.title: 德国最大的联邦银行将提供加密货币托管服务
item.description: 德国最大的联邦银行巴登-符腾堡州银行计划与 Bitpanda 交易所合作，开始提供加密货币托管服务。【原文：Landesbank Baden-Württemberg, Germany’s biggest federal bank, plans to start offering cryptocurrency custody services in partnership with the Bitpanda exchange.】

item.title: 以色列谢克尔上涨，交易商关注伊朗袭击的应对措施
item.description: 以色列货币走强，原因是交易商权衡了全球领导人为避免在伊朗直接发动袭击后爆发更大规模中东战争所做的努力。【原文：Israel’s currency strengthened as traders weighed efforts by global leaders to avert a wider Middle East war following a direct attack by Iran.】

item.title: 当前英国市场的动向
日本最大的电力生产商 Jera 考虑通过 IPO 资助绿色事业
item.description: 日本最大的公用事业公司 Jera Co. 正在考虑首次公开募股，为大规模推广可再生能源提供资金。【原文：Japan’s biggest utility, Jera Co., is considering an initial public offering to help fund a massive rollout of renewables.】

item.title: 生力签署 2024 年最大一笔亚洲美元贷款以偿还债务
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，生力公司已签署了今年迄今为止亚洲最大的银团美元贷款，为将于 12 月到期的一笔类似借款进行再融资。【原文：San Miguel Corp. has signed the biggest syndicated dollar loan in Asia so far this year to refinance a similar borrowing facility due in December, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 陷入困境的韩国建筑商 Taeyoung 将公布改革方案
item.description: 韩国 Taeyoung Engineering & Construction Co.的债权人很快就能了解这家陷入困境的建筑商提出的重组方案的细节。【原文：Creditors of South Korea’s Taeyoung Engineering & Construction Co. will soon be able to learn details of the distressed builder’s restructuring proposal.】

item.title: 美国和欧洲股票期货上涨；伊朗袭击事件对其影响不大
item.description: 美国和欧洲股票期货在亚洲交易时段上涨，市场对中东紧张局势加剧反应平淡。【原文：US and European stock futures gain in Asian trading hours in muted market reaction to heightened Middle East tensions.】

item.title: 利润重燃，英国小型股票迎来赶超时机
item.description: 与蓝筹股相比，英国小型股的前景改善得更快，经济形势的好转将促进利润的增长。【原文：The outlook for Britain’s smaller stocks is improving more quickly than that of their blue-chip peers, with a brighter economic backdrop set to boost profits.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利聘用黄志明推动中国资产管理发展
item.description: 摩根士丹利聘请前瑞士信贷银行家黄敏领导其中国投资管理部门，该美国公司正在重新调整其共同基金业务，并扩大其在世界第二大经济体的产品供应。【原文：Morgan Stanley hired former Credit Suisse banker Min Huang to lead its China investment management division as the US firm recalibrates its mutual fund business and expands its product offerings in the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 摆脱中东的埃斯库罗斯陷阱
item.description:
市场和世界需要以色列和伊朗打破复仇循环，他们也是如此。蓝图就在希腊悲剧中。【原文：

Markets and the world need Israel and Iran to break the cycle of vengeance — and so do they. The blueprint lies in Greek tragedy. 

】

item.title: 中国因泡沫风险加强对非法债券交易的审查
item.description: 中国正在调查一些金融公司可能存在的非法债券交易行为，这是主权债务市场反弹后，当局希望为投机降温的最新迹象。【原文：China is looking into potentially illegal bond trading behavior by some financial firms, the latest sign that authorities are keen to cool speculation following a rally in the sovereign debt market.】

item.title: 中国将停止直播外资流入股市的情况
item.description: 中国将很快停止显示通过香港流入世界第二大股票市场的实时数据，从而屏蔽了一个受到密切关注的外国情绪指标。【原文：China will soon cease displaying real-time data for flows into the world’s second-largest stock market through Hong Kong, shielding a closely-watched indicator of foreign sentiment.】

item.title: 新加坡新房销售创四个月最大增幅
item.description: 在一系列郊区项目的推出刺激了购房热情之后，新加坡的房屋销售量出现了四个月来的最大涨幅，从低迷中反弹。【原文：Singapore home sales rose the most in four months, rebounding from a lull after the launch of a range of suburban projects fueled purchases.】

item.title: 国债的避险作用面临油价影响的压力
item.description: 市场人士表示，如果石油压力引发通胀担忧，美国国债可能会失去部分避险吸引力。【原文：US Treasuries may lose some of their haven appeal if pressure on oil fans inflation fears, market participants say.】
